wikipedia_page.main: Finnegan Oldfield (born 10 January 1991) is a French-British actor. He was born in Lewes, England. He has appeared in more than thirty films since 2003.

link_mentions.page: César Award for Most Promising Actor
response: |Finnegan Oldfield || Marvin || Marvin ou la belle éducation
* Finnegan Oldfield – Marvin (Marvin ou la Belle Éducation)
Jury: Christophe Barratier (President), Alma Jodorowsky, Félix Moati, Marie Modiano, Finnegan Oldfield, Élisabeth Perez, Serge Riaboukine

link_mentions.page: Lumières Award for Most Promising Actor
response: |Finnegan Oldfield || Bang Gang (A Modern Love Story) || Bang Gang
* Finnegan Oldfield as The pump attendant
* Finnegan Oldfield as Paul de Lamare
* Finnegan Oldfield — Bang Gang (A Modern Love Story)

The film stars Finnegan Oldfield as Marvin, a gay actor in Paris who is struggling to write and perform a one-man theatrical show about his childhood. It is noted for an appearance by Isabelle Huppert, playing herself.

Gone for Good (French: "Disparu à jamais") is a 2021 French-language streaming television series created by David Elkaïm and Vincent Poymiro based on Harlan Coben's 2002 novel, Gone for Good. The series stars Finnegan Oldfield, Nicolas Duvauchelle and Guillaume Gouix.
